titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-725, by Mrs. Capito.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 251.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1102.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/8/2006--Passed House without amendment. Waives the requirement of Rule XIII of the House of Representatives for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to any resolution reported on December 8, 2006. Makes it in order at any time on December 8, 2006, for the Speaker to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules.
